subject: Re: [junit] Problems with one time setup and teardown
msgSnippet: Hi, I found the problem. I used the Eclipse wizard to generate a class that runs all tests. In this class it usually calls each testcase like this:
messageBody:
Hi,

I found the problem. I used the Eclipse wizard to generate a class
that runs all tests. In this class it usually calls each testcase like
this:

suite.addTestSuite(TestPasswordUtils.class);

However, when you add the one-time setup and teardown code it needs to
be called like this:

suite.addTest(TestIFSTSecurityService.suite());

Thanks

Rakesh

On 6/21/05, patelr08 <rakesh.mailgroups@...> wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I'm trying to use the one time setup functionality of junit to set up
> a db connection for subsequent tests but finding that the code is
> never called.
>
> Here's my testcase:
>
> public class TestSecurityService extends TestCase {
> private static OracleDataSource ds;
> private SecurityService ss;
>
> protected void setUp() throws Exception {
> if (ds == null) {
> ds = new OracleDataSource();
> ds.setDriverType("thin");
> ds.setServerName("177.12.56.110");
> ds.setNetworkProtocol("tcp");
> ds.setDatabaseName("orcl");
> ds.setPortNumber(1521);
> }
>
> ss = new SecurityService(ds);
> }
>
> public void testLoginSuccess() throws LoginException {
> Subject subject = ss.login("scott".toCharArray(),
> "Passw0rd".toCharArray());
> assertNotNull("Successful login", subject);
> }
>
> public void testLoginFailure() {
> Subject subject;
>
> try {
> subject = ss.login("nobody".toCharArray(),
> "nothing".toCharArray());
> fail("Expected LoginException because invalid
> username/password");
> } catch (LoginException e) {
> // ignore because test passed
> }
> }
>
> public void testChangePassword() throws LoginException {
> Subject subject = ss.changePassword("scott".toCharArray(),
> "Passw0rd".toCharArray(), "NewPassw0rd".toCharArray());
> assertNotNull(subject);
> }
>
> public static void oneTimeSetup() {
> System.out.println("oneTimeSetUp");
> }
>
> public static void oneTimeTearDown() {
> System.out.println("oneTimeTearDown");
> }
>
> public static Test suite() {
> TestSetup setup = new TestSetup(new
> TestSuite(TestIFSTSecurityService.class)) {
> protected void setUp() throws Exception {
> oneTimeSetup();
> }
>
> protected void tearDown() throws Exception {
> oneTimeTearDown();
> }
> };
> return setup;
> }
> }
>
> Any ideas what I'm doing wrong?
>
> Thanks
>
> Rakesh
